{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3592323,"name":"Sipan Merhas","username":"sipanakcan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sipanakcan/{size}/259769_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T20:29:07.990Z","cooked":"

For a team that currently uses SDS MK4 swerve modules, a new swerve module will be purchased. This module should be one of WCP’s swerve options. The new module will be either the X2i or the X2t. Which one do you think makes more sense to go with?

Depending on next season’s game theme, it might make sense to use the X2t to build a chassis that allows for a wider center area. Of course, this depends entirely on the game. I’m curious to hear your thoughts on this.

A separate question unrelated to this:
If it’s technically possible, would building a chassis with X2t on one side and SDS MK4 on the other be a viable design strategy? There would be a reduction mismatch between the modules. It’s a bit of a crazy idea, but I’d love to hear what you think about it

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T20:29:07.990Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":66,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":408.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499327,"topic_slug":"choosing-the-next-swerve-module-is-x2i-or-x2t-the-better-fit","display_username":"Sipan Merhas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68448,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/choosing-the-next-swerve-module-is-x2i-or-x2t-the-better-fit/499327/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3592329,"name":"Nick Matthes ","username":"nmatthes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nmatthes/{size}/193329_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T20:37:41.260Z","cooked":"

Just putting it out there - look into the X2S as well. We (33) have used them this year and LOVE them. We are using the regular and flipped versions on our bot this year.

The X2St really looks great. I’m grateful for your feedback.

We are running two different modules (3 MK4i and 1 MK4n) to make room for our offset elevator, though the only difference here is the steer ration. Depending on your swerve library, you’ll have to do a bit extra work to get each module to have different gear ratios. I wouldn’t recommend having multiple different modules just on the basis that it increases the number of spare modules you’ll need for a given event.
